title: XV Anniversary of the Mathematics-Economics Program
text:
Program



The schedule for the event is available here.


At Aalborg University, we are excited to celebrate the 15th anniversary of the Mathematics-Economics program üéâ!
This milestone event will bring together students, alumni, faculty, and industry leaders to connect, reflect, and look ahead.

Why Attend?

üëâ Panel Discussions: Gain insights from distinguished alumni.
üëâ Program Evolution: Explore the history and future of our program.
üëâ AI and the Future Job Market: Engage in forward-thinking dialogues.



Date and Location

üìÖ Date: September 13, 2024
üïí Time: 13:30 - 17:30 (Dinner from 18:00)
üìç Location: AAU Innovate, Thomas Manns Vej 25, 9220 Aalborg East





Registration
‚úç Register today to save your spot: https://forms.office.com/e/mUwStPb8wY
üïí Deadline for registration is August 30. Deadline extended for students and graduates to September 5.


Gala Dinner
The celebration will conclude with a gala dinner, offering an evening of good food and great conversation.
Seating for the dinner is limited, so make sure to register early. The event is free for everybody to attend. The price to join the dinner will be shared shortly.


Contact
For any questions regarding the event, please contact J. Eduardo Vera Vald√©s.
We look forward to celebrating with you!


Industry partners
We would like to thank the generous support of our industry partners:









Centrica Energy







Spar Nord







InCommodities

title: Lunch Seminar Series
text:
The Lunch Seminar Series (LSS) is a monthly event hosted by the Department of Mathematical Sciences at Aalborg University. The series is aimed to provide a platform to present and discuss research in a more casual setting.
The seminars are held on a Friday from 12:15 to 13:00 at the latest but usually end earlier. For the fall 2024 semester, they will be held in Fib16 1.201. The event is open to everyone, you only need to bring your lunch and enjoy the presentations.
The LSS is organized by Eduardo Vera-Vald√©s. If you are interested in presenting your work, please use this email. Currently, we are accepting volunteers for the spring 2025 semester.

title: Department of Mathematical Sciences, Aalborg University
text:
This is the offstage page for the Department of Mathematical Sciences. You can find the official website here. This website is used for fast updates and hosting of events and research projects. It does not replace the official website, which maintains the official information.

Seminar Series
The Department of Mathematical Sciences at Aalborg University hosts a monthly seminar series. You can find more information here.


Earth Day and Climate Econometrics
The Department of Mathematical Sciences at Aalborg University is committed to the study of Climate Change and its impacts on society. It hosts the Climate AAU Hub, containing Climate Econometrics Research Projects and the yearly Earth Day Events.


XV Anniversary of the Mathematics-Economics Program
The Mathematics-Economics Program at Aalborg University celebrates its 15th anniversary. The Department is hosting an event to bring together students, alumni, faculty, and industry leaders to connect, reflect, and look ahead. You can find more information here.


Long Memory Symposium
The Long Memory Symposium is a collaboration between Aalborg University and Aarhus University. The event will bring together researchers from across the world to discuss the latest advances in long memory processes and their applications. You can find more information here.

title: About
text:
This is the offstage page for the Department of Mathematical Sciences. You can find the official website here. This website is used for fast updates and hosting of events and research projects. It does not replace the official website, which maintains the official information.
The site is maintained by J. Eduardo Vera-Vald√©s. Report any issues here.

title: AWE VI Long Memory Symposium
text: In collaboration with Morten √òrregaard Nielsen and Mikkel Bennedsen from Aarhus University, we are excited to announce the revival of the Long Memory Symposium. This event will bring together researchers from across the world to discuss the latest advances in long memory processes and their applications.

title: AWE VI Long Memory Symposium
text:
Date and Location

üìÖ Date: November 28 and 29, 2024
üìç Location: Aarhus University, Aarhus, Denmark

title: AWE VI Long Memory Symposium
text:
Invited Speakers
Invitations are being sent to a number of leading researchers in the field. We will update the list of confirmed speakers as soon as possible.

title: AWE VI Long Memory Symposium
text:
PhD Course
In addition to the symposium, we will offer a PhD course on long memory processes as part of the DGPE. The course will be held at Aalborg University on November 26 and 27, 2024, right before the start of the Symposium.
All participants in the course are invited to attend the Symposium free of charge.
More details about the course and registration will be available soon.
We look forward to welcoming you to Denmark in November!
